sentence: The Dow Jones Industrial Average, S&P 500 and NASDAQ are higher on Monday afternoon.
Some of the most actively traded stocks include AT&T ( T ) up 1.84%, Apple ( AAPL ) up 1.25%, Bank of America ( BAC ) higher by 1.04%, and Vale ( VALE ) down 5.2%.
In overseas trading, Japan's Nikkei 225 Stock Average was up 0.80%, and the Hang Seng was down 0.83%.
In Europe, the FTSE 100 was higher, up 0.12% and the German DAX was up 1.29% today.
In economic news, Housing Starts is released tomorrow, Initial Claims on Thursday, and CPI on Friday.
Some of the companies releasing earnings this week include: Home Depot ( HD ) on Tuesday, Hormel Foods (HRL) on Wednesday, Dollar Tree (DLTR) on Thursday, and Deere & Co. (DE) on Friday.
Join us on Friday for the Weekly Market Wrap and have a wonderful week.
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
